N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 903.7 - Marketing materials

State Regulations
(a) For
purposes of this section, marketing materials shall mean any financial
statement, pamphlet, circular, graphic, form letter, or other sales literature
or advertising communication intended for or directed to prospective residents
of the life care community or proposed life care community or to the general
public. (b) All marketing
materials, including all materials associated with a sales office and model
units, used in the solicitation of priority reservation agreements and priority
reservation fees shall, at a minimum, contain the following statements: (1)

The purpose of the marketing material is: (i) in the case of a proposed community, to
test the market demand for the proposed community and to allow prospective
residents to place their names on a priority waiting list for admission to the
community; or
(ii)
in the case of
an existing community operating under a life care contract, to allow
prospective residents to place their names on a priority waiting list for
admission to the community. (2)

The cancelable priority reservation
agreement is not a life care contract and may be canceled by the prospective
resident or the prospective resident's legal representative at any time, without cause. (3)

Any priority
reservation fee paid shall be deposited directly into an escrow account and
shall be refunded with interest earned at the prevailing rates upon request and
cancellation of the agreement by the prospective resident or the prospective
resident's legal representative. (c) All marketing materials shall comply with
the standards set forth in section
901.6
(c)-(k)
of
this Title. Notes
